* Steve Smith guided the Washington Freedom to their maiden MLC title, finishing as the franchise's equal leading run-scorer with 336 runs at a strike rate of 148.67.
* Smith played a crucial role in the final against the San Francisco Unicorns, scoring 88 off 52 balls, and was adjudged the player-of-the-match.
* This strong performance has given Smith hope of returning to the Indian Premier League (IPL) next year.

* Steve Smith, a veteran Australian batter, guided the Washington Freedom to their maiden MLC title.
* Smith finished the tournament as the franchise's equal leading run-scorer with 336 runs at a strike rate of 148.67.
* He played a crucial role in the final against the San Francisco Unicorns, scoring 88 off 52 balls against a bowling attack that featured Australian captain Pat Cummins and Pakistan quick Haris Rauf.
* Smith was adjudged the player-of-the-match for his performance in the final.

* Pat Cummins, Australia's Test captain, recently returned from the USA after his maiden stint in the Major League Cricket (MLC).
* Cummins has been rested for the white-ball tour of UK to manage his workload, ahead of a busy summer.

* Australia Test captain Pat Cummins recently returned from the United States after playing in the inaugural Major League Cricket (MLC) tournament.
* This was Cummins' maiden stint in the MLC tournament.
* Cummins has taken an eight-week break to recover and prepare for the upcoming Border-Gavaskar Trophy against India later this year.

Steve Smith, the Australian batsman, has had a successful run in the Major League Cricket (MLC) 2024, finishing as the second-highest run scorer with 336 runs from nine innings at an average of 56 and a strike rate of 148.67, including three half-centuries. He led his team, Washington Freedom, to their maiden MLC title, playing a match-winning knock of 88 (52) in the final.

* Australia captain Pat Cummins recently played in the Major League Cricket (MLC) in the United States of America.
* Cummins took a break from cricket, including being rested for the white-ball tour of the United Kingdom, to manage his workload and prepare for the Border-Gavaskar Trophy against India.
* This break also allowed him to recover from hamstring and ankle issues, which he will address through gym work, running, and rehab exercises.

Pat Cummins, Australia's Test captain, made his debut in the Major League Cricket (MLC) in the United States. After completing his debut stint, Cummins has announced an eight-week break to rest and recharge ahead of the Border-Gavaskar Trophy series against India later this year.

* Australian cricket team captain Pat Cummins recently participated in the inaugural season of Major League Cricket (MLC) in the United States.
* Cummins took a break from the white-ball series in the UK to manage his workload and prepare for the upcoming Australian summer cricket season.
* He mentioned that the break allowed him to rest and recover from a packed 18 months of continuous bowling, which included participating in various international tournaments and leagues, including the MLC.

* Australian Test captain Pat Cummins recently returned from the United States after his maiden Major League Cricket campaign.
* Cummins played for the San Francisco Unicorns in the MLC, taking four wickets at 52.75 in six games.
* In the MLC final against the Washington Freedom, Cummins took 2-35, removing national teammates Travis Head and Steve Smith, but the Unicorns lost by 96 runs.
